intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: How many computer science classes have been canceled or at risk of being canceled for the 2025-26 year?
questions.explanation: In an email to The Herald, Kathi Fisler, co-director of the department’s undergraduate program, attributed the changes in part to faculty members being on “sabbatical or other forms of leave.”

questions.question: What place did the women’s swimming and diving team earn at the Ivy League Championships on Feb. 19?
questions.explanation: The women’s swimming and diving team made waves at the Ivy League Championships last week, totaling 998.50 points and splashing into a fourth-place finish.

questions.question: How many students from Brown received a Fulbright Scholarship during the 2024-2025 cycle?
questions.explanation: Brown was named the top producing school of Fulbright U.S. students for the 2024-25 academic year, earning the recognition for the fifth time in the past decade.

questions.question: What season of Survivor will a Brown PhD student compete in?
questions.explanation: Eva Erickson GS, a third-year graduate student in fluids and thermal sciences, competed as a contestant on the 48th season of the hit reality TV show “Survivor,” which premiered on Wednesday night.

questions.question: Rhode Island’s 2021 Act on Climate calls for net-zero emissions by:
questions.explanation: In 2021, Governor Dan McKee signed the 2021 Act of Climate, which set emission reduction mandates. This calls for net zero emissions by 2050.

questions.question: What do RISD students no longer have to participate in past their first year?
questions.explanation: RISD officials said that the change aims to return Wintersession to its original purpose of deeply exploring specific disciplines, diving into special topics or learning new experimental techniques.

questions.question: Where will Ivy Madness take place?
questions.explanation: Brown will host Ivy Madness for the first time in the tournament’s history.

questions.question: What percent of the Class of 2024 double concentrated?
questions.explanation: While Herald polling found 40% of the class of 2027 intended to pursue a double-concentration, 32% of the class of 2024 graduated with two concentrations, according to Brown’s Office of Institutional Research.

questions.question: What did Brown’s 14th provost major in as an undergraduate?
questions.explanation: Fascinated by chemistry, physics and math in high school, Francis Doyle pursued chemical engineering, following in the footsteps of his father and brother.

questions.question: How many Brown professors were awarded a career research fellowships through the the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation?
questions.explanation: The Alfred P. Sloan Foundation awarded three Brown professors with early career research fellowships last week. The Sloan Research Fellowship awards $75,000 in research funding over the course of two years to researchers who have shown creativity and innovation early in their careers.
